<title level="1" pfs="">[Urchin](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3453)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Although their escapades might be notorious, few urchins are thrill-seekers. For some urchins, when begging alone isn't enough to fill their bellies, theft becomes a viable survival tactic. Many criminal groups also use urchins as spies and messengers, while training them to become future pickpockets, burglars, and foot soldiers.

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 8
</column>

<actions string="Single Action" />
shiv +5 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)),
**Damage** 1d4–1 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +5 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4–1 bludgeoning

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
rock +5 ([thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)),
**Damage** 1d4–1 bludgeoning

**Collaborative Thievery**   The urchin gains a +1 circumstance bonus to [Steal](/Actions.aspx?ID=2410) or [Palm an Object](/Actions.aspx?ID=2409) while within 10 feet of an ally who has the pickpocket ability.

**Pickpocket**   For an urchin, the DC to [Steal](/Actions.aspx?ID=2410) or [Palm an Object](/Actions.aspx?ID=2409) isn't increased by 5 for an item that's closely guarded. They can Steal objects that would be extremely noticeable or time-consuming to remove (like worn shoes, armor, or actively wielded objects).

</column>
